# Tidyverse grammer
- select(): Returns a sub set of columns
- filter(): Returns a subset of rows
- mutate()
- arrange()
- summarize()

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(mdsr)
#Subset of rows
filter(CIACountries, pop > 1000000000)

#I can also do it like this
CIACountries %>% filter(pop > 1e9)

#In base R
CIACountries[CIACountries$pop > 1e9,]

#or
subset(CIACountries, pop > 1e9)

```
